subject: Self Care
title: Stress and Hormonal Disruption
description: A fast breakdown of Stress and Hormonal Disruption for builders.

hook.text: A woman under extreme stress misses her period. A man's testosterone drops. Stress hijacks hormones.

buildup.text: When cortisol stays high, the body diverts resources from reproductive and thyroid hormones to survive.

discovery.text: Chronic stress can suppress fertility, alter menstrual cycles, reduce libido, and disrupt thyroid function.

twist.text: Doctors often treat hormonal symptoms individually without addressing the underlying chronic stress.

climax.text: Fixing the stress often fixes the hormones. The body restores balance when the threat signal fades.

punchline.text: Chronic stress steals hormones your body needs.

quiz.question: Why does chronic stress disrupt hormones?
options: The body diverts resources to survival over reproduction
